intro: Brassica briggsii, commonly known as the Australian mustard, is a herbaceous plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, round pods that contain seeds. Brassica briggsii is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments.
